body:
Comment 3 by **danielarndt**: 
The trouble is that I do not want to read the entire input. If I get some bad input and
want to exit my program, I find it rather silly to have to flush the remainder of input
(however long that may be?) before exiting.

In the way Go handles this, someone can write a program which seemingly does nothing
harmful, however, using some clever tricks perhaps have a user do something detrimental?
It also seems rather unintuitive to pass the remainder of this input to the calling
program?

Either way, if you say this is the way it shall be, I will deal. Thanks.
